verses.verse: Then the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> to me, "Even though<WH518> Moses<WH4872> and Samuel<WH8050> were to stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> Me, My heart<WH5315> would not be with this<WH2088> people;<WH5971> send<WH7971> them away<WH7971> from My presence<WH6440> and let them go!<WH3318>

"And it shall be that when<WH3588> they say<WH559> to you, 'Where<WH575> should we go<WH3318>?' then you are to tell<WH559> them, 'Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord:<WH3068> "Those [destined] for death,<WH4194> to death;<WH4194> And those [destined] for the sword,<WH2719> to the sword;<WH2719> And those [destined] for famine,<WH7458> to famine;<WH7458> And those [destined] for captivity,<WH7628> to captivity.<WH7628>"'

"And I shall appoint<WH6485> over<WH5921> them four<WH702> kinds<WH4940> [of doom,]" declares<WH5002> the Lord:<WH3068> "the sword<WH2719> to slay,<WH2026> the dogs<WH3611> to drag<WH5498> off, and the birds<WH5775> of the sky<WH8064> and the beasts<WH929> of the earth<WH776> to devour<WH398> and destroy.<WH7843>

"And I shall make<WH5414> them an object<WH2113> of horror<WH2113> among all<WH3605> the kingdoms<WH4467> of the earth<WH776> because<WH1558> of Manasseh,<WH4519> the son<WH1121> of Hezekiah,<WH2396> the king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> for what<WH834> he did<WH6213> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>

"Indeed,<WH3588> who<WH4310> will have<WH2550> pity<WH2550> on you, O Jerusalem,<WH3389> Or who<WH4310> will mourn<WH5110> for you, Or who<WH4310> will turn<WH5493> aside<WH5493> to ask<WH7592> about your welfare<WH7965>?

"You who have forsaken<WH5203> Me," declares<WH5002> the Lord,<WH3068> "You keep going<WH1980> backward.<WH268> So I will stretch<WH5186> out My hand<WH3027> against<WH5921> you and destroy<WH7843> you; I am tired<WH3811> of relenting!<WH5162>

"And I will winnow<WH2219> them with a winnowing<WH2219> fork<WH4214> At the gates<WH8179> of the land;<WH776> I will bereave<WH7921> [them] of children,<WH7921> I will destroy My people;<WH6> They did not repent<WH5971> of their ways.<WH7725>

"Their widows<WH490> will be more<WH4480> numerous<WH6105> before Me Than<WH4480> the sand<WH2344> of the seas;<WH3220> I will bring<WH935> against them, against<WH5921> the mother<WH517> of a young<WH970> man,<WH970> A destroyer<WH7703> at noonday;<WH6672> I will suddenly<WH6597> bring<WH5307> down<WH5307> on her Anguish<WH9409> and dismay.<WH928>

"She who bore<WH3205> seven<WH7651> [sons] pines<WH535> away;<WH535> Her breathing<WH5301> is labored.<WH5301> Her sun<WH8121> has set<WH935> while it was yet<WH5750> day;<WH3119> She has been<WH954> shamed<WH954> and humiliated.<WH2659> So I shall give<WH5414> over their survivors<WH7611> to the sword<WH2719> Before<WH6440> their enemies,<WH340>" declares<WH5002> the Lord.<WH3068>

Woe<WH188> to me, my mother,<WH517> that you have borne<WH3205> me As a man<WH376> of strife<WH7379> and a man<WH376> of contention<WH4066> to all<WH3605> the land!<WH776> I have neither<WH3808> lent,<WH5383> nor<WH3808> have men lent<WH5383> money to me, [Yet] everyone<WH3605> curses<WH7043> me.

The Lord<WH3068> said,<WH559> "Surely<WH518> <WH3808> I will set<WH8281> you free<WH8281> for [purposes of] good;<WH9185> Surely<WH518> <WH3808> I will cause the enemy<WH340> to make<WH6293> supplication<WH6293> to you In a time<WH6256> of disaster<WH9567> and a time<WH6256> of distress.<WH6869>
"Can anyone smash<WH9570> iron,<WH1270> Iron<WH1270> from the north,<WH6828> or bronze<WH5178>?
"Your wealth<WH2428> and your treasures<WH214> I will give<WH5414> for booty<WH957> without<WH3808> cost,<WH4242> Even for all<WH3605> your sins<WH9128> And within all<WH3605> your borders.<WH1366>

"Then I will cause your enemies<WH340> to bring<WH5674> [it] Into a land<WH776> you do not know;<WH3045> For a fire<WH784> has been<WH6919> kindled<WH6919> in My anger,<WH639> It will burn<WH3344> upon you."

Thou who knowest,<WH3045> O Lord,<WH3068> Remember<WH2142> me, take<WH6485> notice<WH6485> of me, And take<WH5358> vengeance<WH5358> for me on my persecutors.<WH7291> Do [not,] in view of Thy patience,<WH750> take<WH3947> me away; Know<WH3045> that for Thy sake<WH5921> I endure<WH5375> reproach.<WH2781>

Thy words<WH1697> were found<WH4672> and I ate<WH398> them, And Thy words<WH1697> became<WH1961> for me a joy<WH8342> and the delight<WH8057> of my heart;<WH3824> For I have been called<WH7121> by Thy name,<WH8034> O Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts.<WH6635>

I did not sit<WH3427> in the circle<WH5475> of merrymakers,<WH7832> Nor<WH3808> did I exult.<WH5937> Because<WH4480> <WH6440> of Thy hand<WH3027> [upon me] I sat<WH3427> alone,<WH910> For Thou didst fill<WH4390> me with indignation.<WH2195>

Why<WH4100> has my pain<WH3511> been<WH1961> perpetual<WH5331> And my wound<WH4347> incurable,<WH605> refusing<WH3985> to be healed<WH7495>? Wilt Thou indeed<WH1961> be to me like<WH3644> a deceptive<WH391> [stream] With water<WH4325> that is unreliable<WH539> <WH3808>?

Therefore,<WH3651> thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> "If<WH518> you return,<WH7725> then I will restore<WH7725> you â€“ Before<WH6440> Me you will stand;<WH5975> And if<WH518> you extract<WH3318> the precious<WH3368> from the worthless,<WH9105> You will become<WH1961> My spokesman.<WH6310> They for their part<WH1992> may turn<WH7725> to you, But as for you, you must not turn<WH7725> to them.

"Then I will make<WH5414> you to this<WH2088> people<WH5971> A fortified<WH1219> wall<WH2346> of bronze;<WH5178> And though they fight<WH3898> against<WH413> you, They will not prevail<WH3201> over you; For I am with you to save<WH3467> you And deliver<WH5337> you," declares<WH5002> the Lord.<WH3068>
"So I will deliver<WH5337> you from the hand<WH3027> of the wicked,<WH7451> And I will redeem<WH6299> you from the grasp<WH3709> of the violent.<WH6184>"
